verses.roman:
kaśyapo 'haṁ ca sāvarṇī
rāma-śiṣyo 'kṛtavranaḥ
adhīmahi vyāsa-śiṣyāc
catvāro mūla-saṁhitāḥ

synonyms: kaśyapaḥ—Kaśyapa; aham—I; ca—and; sāvarṇiḥ—Sāvarṇi; rāma-śiṣyaḥ—a disciple of Rāma; akṛtvraṇaḥ—namely Akṛtavraṇa; adhīmahi—we have assimilated; vyāsa-śiṣyāt—from the disciple of Vyāsa (Romaharṣaṇa); catvāraḥ—four; mūla-saṁhitāḥ—basic collections.
translation: Romaharṣaṇa, a disciple of Vedavyāsa, divided the Purāṇas into four basic compilations. The sage Kaśyapa and I, along with Sāvarṇi and Akṛtavraṇa, a disciple of Rāma, learned these four divisions.
